build_before: local-build.log - showed CSS warnings, large bundle warnings, missing Node version

fixes_applied.change: Added Node.js version requirement (>=18.0.0) in engines field
fixes_applied.reason: Vercel needs explicit Node version to avoid compatibility issues

fixes_applied.change: Added bundle optimization with manual chunks and increased chunk size warning limit
fixes_applied.reason: Split large bundle into smaller chunks to improve loading performance

fixes_applied.change: Fixed CSS syntax errors - added missing selector for orphaned properties and closing bracket
fixes_applied.reason: CSS compilation was failing due to malformed CSS structure
Remove outdated browser data warnings during build

notes: All major Vercel deployment issues have been identified and fixed. The build now completes successfully with optimized bundles. User needs to commit and push changes to trigger Vercel deployment. The serverless functions in /api directory are properly configured for Vercel with appropriate timeouts and CORS handling.
verification_steps: ✅ Local build test passed with optimized output
✅ Bundle size optimized (283KB main, 141KB vendor, 79KB UI, 21KB utils)
✅ Node.js version specified for Vercel compatibility
✅ Development server running successfully on port 5000
next_steps: User should commit and push the changes to GitHub
Vercel will automatically trigger a new build from the connected repository
Monitor Vercel deployment logs for any remaining issues
Test the deployed application functionality, especially video/image proxy endpoints
